commit.message:
gddccontrol: prepare migration to Gtk3 (#160)

* GTK Migration: Do not include individual headers

* GTK Migration: Do not use deprecated symbols

* [WIP] Refactor fullscreen drawing

Changes:
* Drop unused code related to oldvboxbg
* Use Cairo for drawing primitives (lines, rectangles)
* drawShades: Refactor variable names for readability

TODO:
* Use Cairo for drawing points
* Use Pango for drawing labels
* g_object_ref/g_object_unref() handling
* Resolve comments

* [WIP] Gtk migration

Changes:
* Refactor variables `w`, `h` for readability
* Port code to render text to cairo/pango
* Remove superfluous space after function name before parentheses

* [WIP] Remove a few comments

* [WIP] Adapt cairo line drawing

* [WIP] Gtk migration

Changes:
* Reference counting
* Draw lines

* [WIP] Improve reference counting

thanks to Valgrind

PS: Quite a lot of memory is still leaked, which is hard to resolve due
to the design of gddccontrol and due to gtk2 internally leaking memory.
Both lead to lots of leaks which makes it hard to find actual leaks
caused by gddccontrol's code.

* [WIP] Extract and refactor code for colored crosses

Changes:
* Extract code into its own function
* Refactor variable names for readability

* [WIP] consistent function names

* [WIP] fix drawing checker pattern

* [WIP] improve draw_shade

Changes:
* Move code from show_pattern to draw_shade
* Fix draw_shade horizontal line width and positioning
* Refactor cairo context names for readability

* [WIP] Rename cairo context for readability

* Gtk migration: Use accessor functions instead of direct access

committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1697712117 +0200

commit.message:
README: Suggest local installation (#156)

On most linux distributions, `/usr` is reserved for files managed by a package manager (deb, rpm, …). Local (manual) installations should be put into `/usr/local` instead.

See also: https://refspecs.linuxfoundation.org/FHS_3.0/fhs/ch04s09.html

tree bad94acf9beed2b69a9125e203bbacd200214ec3

committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1697384987 +0200

commit.message:
fix: add missing return statement to dbus_monitor_close (#135)

This avoids the following error during build:
```
dbus_client.c: In function 'dbus_monitor_close':
dbus_client.c:52:1: error: no return statement in function returning non-void [-Werror=return-type]
   52 | }
      | ^
```

tree f7e630378665bacc095dbe700c17bc0840185abf
parent 41973c849876742d8be372f22d41b1c108da2931

committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1663140583 +0200

commit.message:
src/lib/Makefile.am: Fix modulesdir (#115)

Hardcoding `/etc` doesn't work if the user running `make install` is using a custom prefix and can't write to system directories.

I [am told](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/pull/148095#discussion_r762344236) that the standard install path for these files is `/usr/lib/modules-load.d/*.conf`. At least it is for [systemd (man 5 modules-load.d)](https://www.systutorials.com/docs/linux/man/5-modules-load.d/).

Cheers

verification.payload:
tree dc2f6ad939b7be8699f97828bf16bbf2d9d91333
parent 75be5f9844317e3b37d0ce5253ad6bc3f7dfb7de
author Rodney Lorrimar <dev@rodney.id.au> 1639058605 +0800
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1639058605 +0100

src/lib/Makefile.am: Fix modulesdir (#115)

Hardcoding `/etc` doesn't work if the user running `make install` is using a custom prefix and can't write to system directories.

I [am told](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/pull/148095#discussion_r762344236) that the standard install path for these files is `/usr/lib/modules-load.d/*.conf`. At least it is for [systemd (man 5 modules-load.d)](https://www.systutorials.com/docs/linux/man/5-modules-load.d/).

Cheers

commit.message:
follow autotools recommended practices (#113)

* Use autotools-approved cleaning declarations

* autotools mkdir

address autoreconf warning:

configure.ac:8: warning: The 'AM_PROG_MKDIR_P' macro is deprecated, and its use is discouraged.
configure.ac:8: You should use the Autoconf-provided 'AC_PROG_MKDIR_P' macro instead,
configure.ac:8: and use '$(MKDIR_P)' instead of '$(mkdir_p)'in your Makefile.am files.

Co-authored-by: Barak A. Pearlmutter <barak+git@pearlmutter.net>

commit.message:
patches: module load, missing link, ditch xml2-config (#108)

* load i2c-dev module at boot


Gbp-Pq: Name 0002-load-i2c-dev-module-at-boot.patch

* cross link

The libddccontrol_dbus_client.so needs to link to libddccontrol.so in
order to have ddcci_parse_caps, ddcci_create_db, etc

Gbp-Pq: Name 0003-cross-link.patch

* no xml2-config

The xml2-config script is deprecated, use pkg-config instead.

Gbp-Pq: Name 0003-no-xml2-config.patch

Co-authored-by: Miroslav Kravec <kravec.miroslav@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Barak A. Pearlmutter <barak+git@pearlmutter.net>

tree a3c6e1866187e48e09e1940c3b1b79e1f5aafb1b
parent 31f13ce33bbd1d7f364c9e7b2589e4edbe2a759e
author Barak A. Pearlmutter <bap@debian.org> 1633076141 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1633076141 +0200

patches: module load, missing link, ditch xml2-config (#108)

* load i2c-dev module at boot

Gbp-Pq: Name 0003-cross-link.patch

* no xml2-config
